document.title: Basic Instruction Package for Meteorological Technicians (BIP-MT)

DA9D9DAEABAA46EA991BBF94D8EA1AFD.description: Describe the main uses of observations from the WMO Integrated Global Observing System and other sources of information

2076B49365324A2EA3F71CC692FC44E6.description: Outline how observations are coded and transmitted, and describe the differences between different types of messages (SYNOP, SHIP, CLIMAT, METAR, etc.)

1EEEFC5654D946D892B97825312825F3.description: Describe the means by which remote sensing from ground and space (including use of satellites, radars, wind profilers, and aircraft, marine and lightning-detection systems) provides information about the atmosphere

578B4D7776F445D080A8B9EB1243634A.description: Explain the physical principles and the limitations of instruments used to make upper-air measurements

1CC0632050654490BDE9CC78036EEF1B.description: Describe national and international measurement standards and best practice for the quality control of observations and calibration and intercomparison of instruments

55E3C848F8C74EF1A3BA6E1BF010DA3B.description: Monitor the weather, make surface observations using remote and directly-read instruments and visual assessments (including identifying cloud types, cloud amount and weather type), and explain the reasons for the visual assessments

EAEE04B08DEB470B9DF3C0F6C292FFD9.description: Describe the various weather phenomena considered when taking a visual surface observation, describe their characteristics and explain their formation

8A838D52FE544B11A78A81588219855B.description: Describe the main cloud types, their characteristics, usual height range, and associated weather phenomena

C5EB9B53322D4A5593829C8283F6320B.description: Describe the various hydrometeors and how they are observed

B1F12E47F16C49B7995C85F4614EADC2.description: Explain the physical principles used in instruments to make surface measurements of temperature, moisture, pressure, precipitation, wind, cloud height, visibility, sunshine and radiation (including instruments used in automatic weather stations), describe how these instruments operate, and outline the kinds of errors that might occur

50202D27D83C48E69199D818BA8E9735.description: Describe the factors that need to be taken into account when siting surface instrumentation

44CCD82628244CA297502B700D8520DD.description: Describe the main components of the WMO Global Observing System and WMO Information System (including the Global Telecommunications System) that are used for making and transmitting meteorological and other environmental observations on a global scale using surface-based and space-based systems

C6B89B27BB8D4AD7B152FC0AE05B06F1.description: Describe the key products and services based on climate information that are provided to the public and other users

D2D192D8AF7540E1B4DA6D0C5B09AC73.description: Describe how climate data is analysed in terms of its distribution (for example, frequency and cumulative frequency), central tendency and variation

E6E4D81868634B9D9C5798FF3C4479AF.description: Describe how climate data is captured, collected and quality-controlled in the meteorological service

D2A6A8B6570F412BB98E8CEA0060D8BF.description: Outline the process and scientific basis for making seasonal forecasts

B7C5A6D3FD334005BC11B29923C1B736.description: Describe the difference between climate variability and climate change, describe the basic concepts behind the greenhouse effect and the basic science involved in human-induced climate change, and describe the basis for climate predictions

4674AC8D337343F494BB74A3FEFD1F0C.description: Describe the climatology and seasonal changes of the region of responsibility and the climatic trend in that region

2FAA360666E84419836CD26571553BA3.description: Describe the techniques for classifying the climate, including the Köppen method

391AB5F5FD5E45E1B89384CF01273204.description: Explain the factors that determine regional and local climates

9B9B33C2B0C64E1F93179B08101DE82F.description: Explain the main features of the global circulation of the atmosphere and oceans and their temporal (diurnal, seasonal, annual) variability

6FB300338342457999100AAE028A8737.description: Describe the function of National Meteorological Services in monitoring and forecasting the weather and the role of other service providers

DA9A18B5830E4C1FB3A45D1671028491.description: Describe the key products and services, including warnings of hazardous weather conditions, based on current and forecast weather information, that are provided to the public and other users

226A67DFD50E4808BECB04D248D1F171.description: Describe the forecasting process, describe the principles behind numerical weather prediction (NWP), and interpret basic operational NWP output

1A429FEAD6D94E9D913B56E280E25BB2.description: Discuss the common systems used within Meteorological Services to (a) display and map data and (b) prepare products and services for users, along with the benefits and shortcomings of the systems

5EC3A245352745B59C8982FEB4C3E447.description: Describe the physical ideas that form the basis of aerological diagrams and perform basic operations on the diagram

64006EA3132F4CD19F85C0AFCF1CD61C.description: Describe different types of upper-air diagrams, including height charts on constant pressure surfaces, identify the main synoptic features on the diagram and the associated satellite and radar imagery, and describe the typical weather associated with those features

26536AD1EC6348DD88F131016A909F28.description: Identify the main synoptic features on surface pressure diagrams and the associated satellite and radar imagery, and describe the typical weather associated with those features

C66AF9D2BE9644F493D1C7B48F91323F.description: Describe the formation and characteristics of hazardous weather systems (for example, thunderstorms, and tropical cyclones) affecting the region of responsibility, the extent to which they can be forecast, and their impact on society

D25C3FBE0CEC447EA2041072E6DA2FDF.description: Describe the formation and characteristics of important mesoscale features affecting the region of responsibility

ED060CDA4FB74B08A0082A108330A49E.description: Describe the main tropical disturbances and their associated weather, including the ITCZ, tropical depressions, monsoons and El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO)

0D2606975B974903965D2375ECBEF5BB.description: Describe the characteristics of depressions, anticyclones, troughs and ridges and their associated weather, with emphasis on those affecting the region of responsibility, describe the characteristics of warm, cold and occluded fronts and the weather associated with their passage, and describe the relationship between jet streams and weather systems

29D2296A3FC04507B6D69254D527D8DB.description: Describe and explain the origin, characteristics, movement and modification of bodies of air

BB508608D4134E92A00F6EE1991F9B5B.description: Explain how the weather experienced at a specific location is a combination of effects acting on different time and space scales

1E0BF4CE03564C3A85CE79EE758448EF.description: Explain the formation of rainbows, haloes, blue skies and lightning

EB7D3D63DDE045CC8867C88E1A715D0D.description: Describe the factors affecting visibility, explain the formation of dew and frost, and explain the causes of fog, with emphasis on radiation and advection fog

496B058EF43A4713B6C26653C972E982.description: Explain why rising motion leads to the formation of clouds, describe the main mechanisms for the formation of clouds, describe the processes that produce precipitation, and describe the triggering processes for thunderstorms and their life cycle

703FD3BD44824AA08AB33E125455460D.description: Explain why winds occur, describe the pressure gradient force and Coriolis force, and explain concepts of the geostrophic and gradient winds, describe the effect of friction on the wind, and explain the causes of common local winds caused by topography (for example, sea/land breezes, foehn winds and katabatic/anabatic winds)

ECD34D6A1E8345149D4D9DECCCCED440.description: Describe the causes of variations in atmospheric stability, explain the concepts of dry adiabatic lapse rate, saturated adiabatic lapse rate and environmental lapse rate, explain various types of stability (for example, absolute, conditional, neutral), explain the role of temperature inversions, and describe how stability and instability develop

04AD1BA27C154081AB1E69D7C446F03E.description: Explain why humidity is important, explain the concepts of vapour pressure, saturated vapour pressure, wet-bulb temperature, dew point and relative humidity, and describe the factors that affect the rate of evaporation

E3908DF27F1B4406B63977614A50BAA1.description: Describe the heating and cooling effect of convection, advection, turbulence and evaporation/condensation, explain the effect of water vapour, cloud and wind on the surface air temperature, explain the diurnal variation in surface air temperature, and describe the main factors that affect the global distribution of surface air temperature

23E9A2CD04234D10A9CFDA7C5515D135.description: Explain why pressure varies with height, explain the effect of temperature and humidity on the variation of pressure with height, and explain why pressure is often reduced to mean sea level

FFDBC81F89CD44BB902CE979F7C47DF8.description: Explain the diurnal, latitudinal and seasonal variations in the radiation reaching the Earth's surface, describe the differences between short- (solar) and long-wave (terrestrial) radiation, describe the processes affecting short- and long-wave radiation (i.e., reflection, scattering and absorption of radiation), outline the heat budget of the Earth's atmosphere, explain the greenhouse effect, explain the role of ozone in affecting ultraviolet radiation, and describe the heat balance at the surface and how it varies with latitude

4C91F31085A74BF987F57B9D709A8A37.description: Describe the composition of the atmosphere and explain its vertical structure

E7F55A502E7E4DB89AEF7C8D790758D9.description: Create, publish and update a basic webpage

332DE62BFA0C450D97628B194FA4F22A.description: Find meteorological information using libraries, databases and internet searches

2130C7048AB14441B459A84A3D4F2D76.description: Perform data processing and statistical analysis using spreadsheets and databases

CA973D8C0DBF472A826E38D5DB0806D4.description: Use basic computer programming principles, and construct a basic computer programme

AC608A778AD9445598C81A62400CA58D.description: Make presentations within stated time limits in which the content and style of delivery accurately conveys information in a way that can be understood by the audience

C05C8520D96447E4999F025B40A2EB08.description: Prepare written communications within specified time limits in a concise, accurate and comprehensible way, including use of word processing and presentation programmes

692D0C2279C24C1BBC86A4B534AC6DC4.description: Describe the main geographical characteristics of the region of responsibility, including a description of the local terrain

54CAAE8D99C543ECA19E0B4080144BD2.description: Describe the hydrological cycle, identifying the key factors determining runoff, groundwater and surface water resources and the water balance, and describe how hydrological measurements are made (precipitation, evaporation, soil moisture, river flow, groundwater, etc.)

6480034319394E34BCEF9AA9818C6D0F.description: Describe the general circulation and thermal structure of the oceans, and describe how measurements of temperature, salinity and sea state are made

7B2265280C154D468DDCF4266C1FF043.description: Outline the scientific and technological advances that have contributed to the development of meteorology and its applications

4DBF886E096F4EB7B30D7C10D7EFE6DD.description: Describe the physical basis of current, voltage and resistance and how these quantities are measured, solve circuit problems (including those with two or more resistors) using Ohm's Law and Kirchhoff's Laws, and describe the process of electromagnetic induction

4D3B27DDAA7A4EBD9F6AE3DB398A0C58.description: Describe the characteristics of electromagnetic radiation and the key features of the electromagnetic spectrum, describe the processes of reflection, absorption and scattering of radiation (including reflection and refraction of light), describe what is meant by a black body, and outline the implications of the Stefan-Boltzmann Law and Wien Law

0A987441D77D4277A98EB73A3A4A612C.description: Describe the properties of oscillations and waves, describe simple harmonic motion, solve problems using the relationship between speed, frequency and wavelength for waves, explain the difference between longitudinal and transverse waves, and explain the concepts of reflection, refraction, diffraction and interference

CFE36867E15F42AA807D86E98567BE29.description: Solve problems using the equation of state for an ideal gas, give a qualitative description of the First Law of Thermodynamics, explain what is meant by an adiabatic process with emphasis on the adiabatic expansion of a gas, and describe the concepts behind the kinetic theory of gases

E42AF8E2D2C34CF285402EC1C79F7A7F.description: Explain the concepts of temperature and heat, describe how physical properties of a substance that varies with temperature can be used to measure temperature, and describe how heat is transferred by conduction, convection and radiation

F880C78068CE43D58C0DFEB901D7D0D8.description: Describe the physical differences between solids, liquids and gases, explain the concept of latent heat associated with a phase change, and describe the processes associated with changes of phase with emphasis on condensation and evaporation

82CFAC59FA084E6FB5C35702517A0EE6.description: Explain the concept of centripetal acceleration and describe circular orbits by relating the gravitational force to the centripetal acceleration

0BFEE037CB144EB288EEC15E1FFA1DAA.description: Explain the concepts of work, kinetic energy, potential energy, internal energy, and solve problems using the principle of the conservation of energy and the relationship between power, work and force

2D011B940B674E6895ECFE1FAF907860.description: Solve basic problems when a system is in equilibrium, solve basic problems using Newton's Second Law of Motion, and solve basic problems using the principle of the conservation of momentum

C7324A6458C242E8949E970B1A9BA288.description: Solve problems using the equations describing the relationship between distance, speed, acceleration and time for uniformly accelerated motion in a straight line

4F63D69DD66F43F7AA679ACD405D2CBD.description: Select suitable ways of displaying statistical data and interpret the results, use different measures of central tendency (mean, median and mode) and variation (range, interquartile range and standard deviation), and explain the concepts of sampling, linear regression by least squares, correlation, normal distribution, percentiles and hypothesis testing

AF81584ADA494096B7B42B3655AF8CAD.description: Interpret the slope and intercept of a linear graph, recognize standard curves such as the parabola, ellipse and hyperbola, and convert between cartesian and polar coordinate systems

E7CF924E7C7346909B3D5BAC7EF71BF3.description: Calculate the areas of right-angled and isosceles triangles, circumference and area of circles, and areas and volumes of rectangular blocks, cylinders and spheres, and describe the relationship between radians and degrees

7C9DF3D7D34744BDB1F1B473E9760B17.description: Manipulate polynomial equations and solve basic algebraic equations, including quadratic equations

A1A775DE54D9430DA8683CA4EE6FE329.description: Add and subtract vectors, and multiply a vector by a scalar

2781DC5E1E234F13AFA01CB018DDBBD6.description: Define sine, cosine and tangent, describe their relationship with their inverse functions, and manipulate basic trigonometrical equations
